name: dredged
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
dredge
dredge verb [T]
(REMOVE)
to remove unwanted things from the bottom of a river, lake, etc. using a boat or special device: They have to dredge the canal regularly to keep it open.
to search an area of water by dredging: The police are dredging the lake for his body. They dredged up (= brought to the surface) all sorts of rubbish from the bottom of the river.

dredge verb [T]
(FOOD)
to drop flour, sugar, etc. over food: Lightly dredge the cake with icing sugar.
